OUTLAWS.Definition: people who lived outside the law, criminals

GUNNED DOWN.Definition: shot and killed with a gun

VOCAL.Definition: speaking out strongly, not afraid to share opinions

ADVOCATE.Definition: a person who publicly supported the idea or cause

QUEST.Definition: a long search for something important

CAMPUS.Definition: the land and buildings of the college

FURIOUSLY.Definition: with great energy, very quickly or angrily

DEADLINE.Definition: the final time or date it must be finished

UTILITY CLOSET.Definition: a small room for storage, often for cleaning or electrical equipment

GAIN.Definition: something he got or benefited from

CENSORSHIP.Definition: control of what people can read, see, or say

COPYRIGHT.Definition: legal right that protects who owns creative work like books, music, or films

TINKER AROUND.Definition: play with or try to fix without a clear plan

DEMOCRATISE.Definition: make it open and available to everyone

NICHE.Definition: a small or special, that few people have

KINDRED SPIRITS.Definition: people who thought or felt the same way as him

CORE.Definition: very important or having a central part

SYNDICATION.Definition: sending the same content to many places at once

HOUSEHOLD NAME.Definition: a person known by almost everyone

STAGE.Definition: a raised platform where he would speak

CLARITY.Definition: the quality of being clear and easy to understand

PEER.Definition: someone of the same rank or level

DISILLUSIONED.Definition: disappointed because things were not as good as he had hoped

FLEDGLING.Definition: new and not yet fully developed

LIKE-MINDED.Definition: having the same interests or ideas

OBSCURE.Definition: not well known or difficult to understand

MERGER.Definition: when the two companies joined together

SEVEN FIGURES.Definition: an amount of money in the millions (with seven digits)

FLATSHARE.Definition: an arrangement in which two or more people lived in the same flat

CLOSET.Definition: a small room or space for storage

HACK IT.Definition: be able to do something successfully

STIFLED.Definition: held back or stopped from acting freely

BEHOLDEN TO.Definition: owing something to someone, having a duty towards them

LICENSE.Definition: have the official permission to use it

MANIFESTO.Definition: a written statement of ideas and goals

MORAL.Definition: related to what is right or wrong

RADICAL.Definition: very extreme or different from usual

JOURNALS.Definition: magazines with academic or scientific articles

MORALLY.Definition: based on what is right or wrong

PAYWALLS.Definition: online barriers that make you pay to read content

MOUSE.Definition: a small device used to control a computer

AROUND THE CLOCK.Definition: all day and all night without stopping

SERVERS.Definition: powerful computers that sent information to other computers

TRACED.Definition: found the source or origin of it

PERPETRATOR.Definition: the person who had done the crime

RED-HANDED.Definition: in the act of doing something wrong

SETTLED.Definition: reached an agreement to end the case

HACKER.Definition: a person who breaks into computer systems

INTERVENE.Definition: step in and try to change what was happening

STEPPED IN.Definition: entered the situation to try to control it

WIRE FRAUD.Definition: a crime of using the internet to trick people and steal money

PRINCIPLED.Definition: acting according to strong beliefs about right and wrong

ACTIVIST.Definition: a person who worked for change in society

CROWBAR.Definition: a strong metal bar used to force things open

PLEADED.Definition: officially admitted in court that he was guilty

PLEA.Definition: a formal statement in court about guilt

PROSPECT.Definition: something that could happen in the future

PLEADING.Definition: the act of saying in court if he was guilty or not guilty

FELON.Definition: a person who had been found guilty of a serious crime

LOOMING.Definition: about to happen soon and causing worry

SWEEPING.Definition: very wide or complete in effect

CENSOR.Definition: block or remove information from public view

BACKED DOWN.Definition: gave up or changed position after pressure

DEPRESSION.Definition: deep sadness that lasted a long time

MAGNIFIED.Definition: made them seem bigger or worse

DEPRESSED.Definition: very sad for a long time

WORN DOWN.Definition: made weak or tired over time

HOUNDED.Definition: harassed, chased, or pressured again and again

AFTERMATH.Definition: the period after the bad event

OVERREACH.Definition: using too much power or going too far

DISOBEDIENCE.Definition: refusing to follow rules or orders

ENRICHMENT.Definition: the act of becoming richer or gaining benefits

MARTYRS.Definition: people who suffered or died for their beliefs
